title: Twitter's top users are posting less since Musk takeover last year, Pew Survey shows
description: A new survey from Pew Research Center shows that the most active Twitter users are posting less frequently than they have in the past.

title: China walks a tightrope, searching for a Ukraine peace deal that doesn’t defeat its ally Russia
description: China's bid to position itself as a peace broker when it comes to Ukraine and Russia presents a "daunting challenge" for Beijing, political analysts say.

title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Take-Two Interactive, Cisco Systems and more
description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in extended trading.

title: Wildfires burn millions of acres in Canada, send oil prices higher
description: The wildfires have burned about 478,000 hectares, or 1,800 square miles, across Alberta, British Columbia and Saskatchewan as of Monday.

title: Biden, McCarthy say U.S. won't default as debt talks inch forward
description: Leaders are running out of time to raise the debt ceiling before a June 1 deadline when the government is set to run out of money.

title: Elon Musk subpoena in Epstein-JPMorgan lawsuit can be served to Tesla, judge rules
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk and co-founders of Google have been issued subpoenas in the Virgin Islands' lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase related to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Microsoft CEO Nadella talks concerns around A.I. and its impact on jobs, education
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella discussed AI in a wide-ranging interview with CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin Tuesday.

title: Amazon's Alexa head says company is 'at the forefront of A.I.' as chatbots explode
description: Rohit Prasad, Amazon's senior vice president and head scientist for Alexa, said the e-retailer will be a major player in generative AI.

title: Dutch claim international first as North Sea offshore wind farms powered down to protect migratory birds
description: The shutdown lasted four hours and is part of a pilot project.

title: Tether buys $222 million worth of bitcoin to back its USDT stablecoin
description: Tether said it would invest 15% of its net profit into bitcoin to "diversify" the reserves that back its USDT token.

title: Cryptos have no intrinsic value and trading in them should be regulated like gambling, UK lawmakers say
description: A U.K. Parliament committee said it was concerned by government proposals to regulate consumer trading of crypto as a financial service.

title: Crypto firm Ripple buys Swiss startup as SEC crackdown forces companies to consider overseas moves
description: Blockchain firm Ripple acquired Metaco, a Swiss crypto custody services firm, the company announced Wednesday.

title: Stellantis warns UK risks exodus of EV production under post-Brexit rules
description: The auto giant faces a steep rise in export tariffs for EVs sent between the U.K. and EU that it says threaten its operations in the U.K.

title: Almost half of Gen Zs have side jobs as money fears take over, survey finds
description: Gen Zs and millennials are increasingly taking on additional full- or part-time jobs, often to supplement their income.

title: Britain's Oxford University cuts ties with Sackler family over opioid links
description: Britain's University of Oxford has cut ties with key benefactor the Sackler family, whose wealth derives from addictive opioid drugs.

title: Tencent posts fastest jump in quarterly revenue in more than a year after China reopens
description: Tencent reported its fastest quarterly revenue growth in more than a year as the company saw a big rebound in payment volumes, ad sales, and gaming.

title: UBS expects $17 billion hit from Credit Suisse rescue, flags hasty due diligence
description: UBS estimates a financial hit of around $17 billion from its emergency takeover of Credit Suisse, according to a regulatory filing.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Inflation weighed on consumer spending
description: Any positive momentum stocks had on Monday dissipated yesterday, as downbeat economic signs weighed on indexes.

title: Sudan one month on: Why cease-fires are failing, and what global leaders are missing
description: One month after fighting between Sudan's two military factions broke out, internationally-brokered peace talks in Saudi Arabia have yielded no solution.

title: JPMorgan and Barclays back $4.5 billion insurance tech giant Wefox
description: Wefox maintained its $4.5 billion valuation from its previous round of funding, the company said.

title: 'Foreign investors are back': Japan stocks surge to their highest since 1990
description: Japan's Topix marked a 33-year high on revived hopes for Japanese equities, with the index outperforming its regional peers year-to-date.

title: Temu accused of data risks after sister app was suspended for malware
description: The U.S. has accused Temu of data risks following the Google suspension of its sister app, but analysts are not too bothered.

title: ‘Benefits outweigh the harm’: Worried about their livelihood, small business owners push back on potential TikTok ban
description: "TikTok has become a scapegoat ... Bytedance is not the first, nor will it be the last, company that misuses our personal data," said one small business owner.

title: Elon Musk talks Tesla, Twitter, and why he tweets freely — even if it costs him money
description: Elon Musk talked to CNBC's David Faber following Tesla's shareholder meeting on Tuesday.
